x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact:
- Real-time alerts and location sharing enable rescue teams to reach victims more quickly and efficiently.

- Continuous health monitoring and SOS features help detect distress early, potentially saving more lives.

- A shared platform for updates, shelters, and volunteer coordination fosters collaboration and mutual aid.

- Offline or satellite-based connectivity ensures critical communication even when traditional networks fail.

- Aggregated insights from wearables will help authorities to know where the impact zones are and improve it for future preparedness plans.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: During disasters, communication networks often fail, leaving people unable to send alerts or share their location. Rescue teams struggle to find victims or assess their health in real time, delaying help. The lack of a unified platform for updates and coordination causes confusion and inefficient aid distribution. Limited real-time data also weakens overall disaster response and recovery efforts.
